awd_titl_txt: UNH Mathematics and Marine Science Program
awd_abstract_narration: The University of New Hampshire Mathematics and Marine Science Program          (UNH M&M Program) will be an integrated approach to introducing                 participants to scientific studies and careers.  This is a three week           summer program consisting of the study of marine science, probability,          statistics, computer analysis of data, and scientific methodology.              Twenty 10th grade students will receive classroom instruction in the            above areas, and participate in four field trips revolving around the           study of coastal issues and environments.  The UNH Sea Grant Program            has access to several wildlife areas including an offshore island               laboratory.  Field trips also will be conducted to Great Bay, Appledore         Island, Odroine Point, Portsmouth Harbor, and local salt marshes.  All          instruction will be provided in a team-teaching format.
org_div_long_name: Division of Research on Learning in Formal and Informal Settings (DRL)
